title: SCS MUS_HIST 335-CN-17 Selected Topics in Music:

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course surveys various forms of music that are indigenous to the music culture of Chicago, such as jazz, blues, gypsy, Irish and klezmer music. By combining interviews, recordings, films and performance, this course connects the student with the neighborhoods and culture that brought these forms of music to Chicago. Presented in a five-week format, this course meets for five Saturdays from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm: 1/7, 1/14, 1/21, 1/28, 2/4. First class attendance is mandatory.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: No prerequisites are needed for this course. The student does not have to have a musical background to take this as well.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The learning objective of this course is to connect the students to the people, places and events that lead to the development of American music in the Chicago area. The underlying objective is to give the student a starting point to explore their own roots and how they are connected to their past.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Attendance and participation are a big part of this course.

subject: MUS_HIST
